component.name: rAV1ator
component.summary: Your Video Copilot: AV1/OPUS Video Encoder

description.p: rAV1ator enables simple, easy-to-use video encoding for the word's most advanced open video codec, AV1. Encode your favorite media into super efficient files with incredible quality per bit, powered by the SVT-AV1 production encoder with Opus for audio encoding. The sky's the limit for your old home video collection & large 4k smartphone videos, and you can fly in style with a beautiful libadwaita interface. Take off with rAV1ator!
Updated rav1e to 0.6.6, fixed typos, cleaned up unnecessary files

This version introduces a few fixes: - The Av1an and rav1e custom parameters box are now bahaving as expected - Fixed concatenation error when the "Downmix to Stereo" box was enabled - Fixed encoding error due to the calculated resolution being a mean number - Automatically switches back to MKV when the audio bitrate is removed from the entry - New warning icon when the WebM container is selected And some other minor tweaks.

This version introduces a great amount of new features: - Removed the "Match source" buttons and replaced by better default behavior - Providing only the width or the height will automatically calculate the other one - Scaling methods can be changed on the go thanks to a simple dropdown menu - Warn the user when going over 100 on the quantizer scale - Grain Synth was replaced for Photon Noise; a chroma noise tick box was added - Introduction of a new "Advanced" tab - Custom av1an and rav1e parameters entries - Workers entry that changes the amount of workers accordingly - If no audio bitrate is specified it copies the audio tracks from the source and grays out the WebM button - Better encoder defaults And some other minor tweaks. Enjoy this new rAV1ator version!

I know it has been a long time coming, but this time, we have a plethora of changes to report! - We've switched our encoding framework to the Rust-based rav1e encoder alongside a video chunking tool called av1an, also written in Rust - Support for more buttons than just the close button in the header bar - Chroma grain synthesis parameter - New tooltips, alongside fixes for the old ones - Fully functional progress bar - A "Stop Encode" button - Optionally downmix audio channels to stereo (for Surround sources) - New About window using AdwAboutWindow - Better defaults - Better Welcome window - Better notifications And probably more minor tweaks that I'm forgetting. Enjoy taking off alongside our shiny new rAV1ator!
